title: Had to carry her on Moped, says Father who lost daughter due to Karnataka hospital's negligence : FYI, News - India Today
text:
FYI Had to carry her on Moped, says Father who lost daughter due to Karnataka hospital's negligence Karnataka family blames government hospital for negligence, claims there were no doctors or even ambulance to take the girl. Father carried his daughter on a moped as no ambulance was available at the hospital. 2 The family claims that the girl died due to negligence by the hospital staff. 3 No doctors or ambulance was available at the hospital, claims family. 
They say negligence is culpable carelessness as time waits for no one and the value of human life is almost non-existent in today's time. Though, many of us might not believe this, but a saddening yet eye-opening incident which occurred in Karnataka proves the above statement right. 
In a shocking event that occurred in Tumkur, Karnataka, a family lost their daughter due to negligent behaviour of the hospital staff. The family of the girl who died in a government hospital claims that she died due to lack of doctors and ambulance. Karnataka family loses child due to negligence (PHOTO:ANI) 
The father carried his daughter on the back of a moped to take her to the hospital as no one was available to take her. The girl was taken to the hospital twice but was not taken care of properly by the hospital staff. Karnataka family loses child due to negligence (PHOTO:ANI) 
The father noticed that her body was ice cold by the evening. The girl died due to carelessness and improper care. Karnataka family loses child due to negligence (PHOTO:ANI) 
The family claims that it all happened due to negligence by the hospital staff.
